result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:01 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Daniel J Adam in court, in custody.  Attorney Justin Griffis for attorney  J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Daniel J Adam. 

Tracking 22CM686.
Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing on November 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:57 AM Defendant Daniel J Adam in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Daniel J Adam. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  

Case called w/20CF1108 (set for sentencing after revocation). 

Defense requests to set this case along with Defendant's new case of 22CF1555, which is set for an initial appearance on 10/20/2022 at 8:15 am. State does not object. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on October 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on October 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:46 AM Defendant Daniel J Adam in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Daniel J Adam.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant has a sentencing after revocation with this Court on 10/05/2022. Defense requests to set this case after sentencing hearing after revocation. Defense has discovery but needs an offer. 
State forwards offer. 

Court sets this case with sentencing after revocation hearing set for 10/05/2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bond was amended to signature bond.

CASH BOND AMENDED TO SIGNATURE BOND ONLY. 
Defendant is to have no contact with any of the victims or apartment complex where alleged incident happened. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant is not to touch or pickup any delivered package unless it is delivered to his residence.

09:34 AM Defendant Daniel J Adam in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Case called for bail/bond hearing. Cash bond of $1000.00 set on 07/01/2022.

State makes arguments in support of cash bail. 

Atty Herbers makes arguments in support of request to reduce cash bail or set a signature bond.

State makes further arguments.

Court will set signature bond.  Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Attorney Herbers.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 7/7/2022 from the defendant requesting a bail/bond hearing.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/18/2022 - The request for bail reduction will be addressed at the next hearing.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
